intro: Elatostema weii, commonly known as the small-leaved elatostema, is a member of the Urticaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Elatostema weii is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
